name: Citrus and Fennel Salad
author: Pete Zaria
summary: Quick delicious salad. Citrus basically dresses itself. You can serve immediately or refrigerate to let flavors come together before serving.
ingredients: ¼ cup thinly sliced sweet onion
directions: Slice top and bottom off 1 orange and set on a flat work surface
Cut downwards from the top, following the curve of the fruit, to remove all of the skin and pith
Hold the orange over a bowl to catch juice; cut both sides of each segment away from the connective membrane and transfer to a separate bowl
Repeat with remaining oranges, grapefruit, and tangerine
Gently toss oranges, grapefruit, tangerine, fennel, and onion together
Add mint, vinegar, and salt; toss gently
